name: Arion, a Luxury Collection Resort & Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: although we initially had a very nice stay in this luxury hotel, the service / personnel lacked enthusiasm and friendliness. the last evening of our stay was ruined by the fact that reception staff insinuated that we deliberately had used an offered discount and were supposed to know that this was not allowed! we hadn't asked for the room service discount card in the first place. we found it in our room after arrival and used it only after having checked that the mentioned discount was valid (the first time). Staff and management took us initially for people with wrong intentions and the Belgian General Manager even addressed threatening words in an e-mail answering our concerns and disappointed after having spent a nice holiday in a star hotel (with a closed pool, for maintenance). I guess we were unlucky.
reviews.title: the garden of eden - beware

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ended up at the Arion Hotel completely by chance. As a frequent Starwood guest, I usually begin my hotel search on their website. They offered a very affordable rate for the Thanksgiving week. The room rate included a terrific buffet breakfast.
reviews.title: Quiet and Restful Off-Season Luxury

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When I checked the hotel reviews on line, I was concerned by all the comments about poor service. This was my first trip to Greece and the impression created by much of this feedback was negative. However, our experience was very different. While the hospitality system in Athens is still not on par with much of the rest of Europe, the service at this hotel was terrific. As an example, we wanted a table at Spondi (The best Restaurant in Greece) on Thanksgiving day. They sorted it out promptly.
reviews.title: nice staff, nice hotel

reviews.text: The front desk was friendly and helpful from the moment we arrived. They were multilingual and were always friendly. As it was the off season, the hotel staff were always prompt and attentive. I must compliment the restaurant staff. We had this terrific breakfast every day and the staff was outstanding. They remembered our coffee preferences and showed us to our "usual" table near the terrace nearly every morning. We tended to linger over the paper and enjoy all the varied baked goods and delicious fresh fruits.
reviews.title: Very nice resort above our expectations

reviews.text: We used the free shuttle to Downtown several days and this was a great amenity.
reviews.title: For Greece very nice...

reviews.text: I stayed here for three days and enjoyed the facility very much. It is right next to Westin, and customers have access to facilities at both places. The view is fantastic, and the atmosphere is relaxing with pools and other beach facilities. There is room in a building and room in bungalows (some with a private pool). The property is extensive and it takes quite a while to walk through. Breakfast has quite some variety. The sushi restaurant Matsuhisa has good ambiance but I found food so-so. The resort is about 45 min drive from city center (and the airport), and they do have a free shuttle that goes there but not so frequently, so if you stayed past 5:30pm be prepared to take a taxi (which is around 25-30 euros). Hotel staff is generally friendly and helpful. But I did have a quite unhappy experience one morning in the breakfast room. I chose a table and told the waiter to bring coffee, and I brought a glass of fruit to the table too. Then when I came back with my plate, the table was occupied by a family and my things were moved to another table in the corner, and the waiter who was serving the family (very attentively) did not even explain or apologize, just plainly told me that he moved me over to another table. I have never been treated this way before (in the 20 some countries that I have been to, and at similar high end hotels or resorts) and think things do need to improve in Greece.
reviews.title: Beautiful resort, far from city center

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed there from a Saturday afternoon to Sunday midday for a romantic get-away with my wife.
reviews.title: Could be a real 5 star experience, let down by typical Greek problems.

reviews.text: Their published rates are hugely expensive but bargain hard right through until the time of check-in and you can get some good deals. I booked a 415 Euro room for 320 Euro, and then was upgraded to a 1000 Euro bungalow without extra charge. Still very expensive, but I knew that when I booked.
reviews.title: Westin next door more modern. Olympic air the worst.

reviews.text: The hotel was built in the 60s and it shows. The design is dated, some of the public areas are a little tired and worn, but generally it is well maintained.
reviews.title: Outstanding

reviews.text: The staff at reception were cheerful and quick. The staff at the bar where we waited to get the keys for our bungalow were slow and badly trained.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.text: Wonderful resort! By the sea. Great views,calm,good air quality.
reviews.title: Excellent stay outside Athens

reviews.text: Nice for pre or post cruise. 25 miles outside Athens
reviews.title: Pleasant surroundings and comfy hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have been to Arion for business training (5 days) and can only say that I've enjoyed.
reviews.title: Overpriced - look elsewhere

reviews.text: It was easy to reach the hotel from Athens airport (taxi night: 40 eur, day 30 eur).
reviews.title: A peaceful hideaway in the most exclusive area in Athens

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms are fine, can't complain. There're convenient meeting/training facilities (although free wifi is only at lobbies/meeting rooms). Additionally juices/water/fruits/coffee have been always served in time (only once they totally mixed up with scheduling).
reviews.title: Simply Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Last minute trip to Athens/Vouliagmeni with the boyfriend (he flew in from London, I from NYC) front desk was very accomodating and gave me the exact room I booked... about 4 hours before check-in time. HUGE deal for me since I didnt catch a wink of sleep and really wanted a shower, hah
reviews.title: Great hotel with a few small issues

reviews.text: The front desk clerks were professional and helpful but one in particular wasnt very polite... At all (unfortunately I encounter attitude somwwhat often, I think because I look like a teenager, hah) Anyway, he scoffed and rolled his eyes at me quite a few times, so I'd just wait until the other clerk was free.
reviews.title: Far exceeded my expectations!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was large with a massive bathroom and balcony with chairs & tables. The beds were so comfortable, as with every Starwood property, and I found myself wanting to sleep everytime I lied down (the heat and jetlag didnt help either)
reviews.title: Beautiful setting, but the staff, service and attitude is very poor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The a/c in the room never got cold enough - we'd turn it as low as it could go but it always felt about upper 70s no matter what. We didnt spend too much time in the room but after being in the sun for a few hours, a cool room to go along with the comfy bed are always nice.
reviews.title: You don't feel like being close to busy Athens..just like on holiday!

reviews.text: The breakfast buffet is tasty - soooo many choices for fresh fruits, meats & cheeses, juice/tea, and hot foods (the chicken wings threw me off a bit) All with a great view of the cove
reviews.title: GREAT SERVICE, FOOD AND LOCATION. Very impressed!

description: A unique place to be!The legendary atmosphere of Arion, a Luxury Collection Resort & Spa is enhanced by contemporary surroundings and spectacular views of the Saronic Gulf. Guest rooms and suites delight the senses with creative touches. The most distinctive feature, the resort's fully renovated bungalows, offer the ultimate in privacy and privileged services.
